channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Party of one: Trump chews up and spits out his inner circle
item.description: President Trump's blowup with Marjorie Taylor Greene is just the latest spectacular split with a one-time confidante who held prized status in his inn...

item.title: Paramount, Comcast, Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
item.description: Hollywood's biggest competition this year isn't at the box office, it's in the Warner Bros. Discovery board room. State of play: A trio of Hollywood p...

item.title: Exclusive: IRS deploys AI agents
item.description: The Internal Revenue Service is rolling out Salesforce's AI agent program, Agentforce, in multiple divisions across the agency, per an announcement sh...

item.title: Rep. Eric Swalwell swipes at Trump as he joins crowded California governor's race
item.description: Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) is joining the 2026 California governor's race, he announced on " Jimmy Kimmel Live " Thursday night. The big picture: T...

item.title: 9/11 families' lawsuit reveals new details linking Saudis to plot
item.description: Saudi Arabia's leader on Tuesday downplayed the kingdom's role in the 9/11 attacks . But an ongoing federal court case is revealing new details about ...

item.title: How billionaires took over American politics
item.description: The current concentration of wealth is unlike anything in history. So is billionaires’ involvement in politics.

item.title: Under Trump, U.S. human rights reports will flag abortion, gender care
item.description: In a dramatic break, the State Department intends to scrutinize other countries’ abuses by emphasizing entitlements “given to us by God.”

item.title: Poll shows most Americans dislike billionaires spending in elections
item.description: Campaign donations from the country’s richest are soaring. But only 12 percent of respondents say billionaires have a positive impact on society.

item.title: The top 20 billionaires influencing American politics
item.description: The group has spent nearly $5 billion on elections since 2015.

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard will no longer classify swastikas, nooses as hate symbols
item.description: The military service, which falls under the Department of Homeland Security, has drafted a new policy that classifies such items “potentially divisive...

item.title: Trump, stung by Republican losses, stands his ground on affordability
item.description: Democrats running on cost-of-living anxieties outperformed Republicans in Tuesday’s elections by greater-than-expected margins. The president chalked ...

item.title: Voters on Tuesday rewarded Democrats who addressed economic costs. Hours later, Trump said he delivered an 'economic miracle.'
item.description: A recent poll found a majority of Americans feel they’re spending more on groceries than they did a year ago.

item.title: Reaganomics in Jersey: Jack Ciattarelli has a supply-side dream if he’s elected governor this week
item.description: The Republican nominee has promised tax cuts and economic growth, but the numbers are fuzzy.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
